licence_overview:
To deal wholesale in veterinary medicines you require wholesale dealer's authorisation from the [Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD).](http://www.vmd.defra.gov.uk "Veterinary Medicines Directorate"){:rel="external"} Even if you don't supply medicines for profit, you still need an authorisation.

You can only supply medicine to which the authorisation relates.

##Conditions

Your premises to be authorised must be clean and free from contamination, secure, lockable and weatherproof. They must also be able to comply with any storage conditions relating to the medicine covered in the authorisation.

You must also have an emergency recall plan and technically competent staff.

The authorisation will detail:

* the medicine covered
* where they are to be stored
* your name and address and the premises address if different
* details of the qualified person to act under the Guidelines on Good Distribution Practice for Human Use

An authorisation will lapse after five years of you don't deal in the medicine covered under it in that time.

You must:

* store medicines as required under the marketing authorisation
* have a stock audit each year
* provide information to the VMD when required 
* comply with the Guidelines on Good Distribution Practice of Medicinal Products for Human Use if the medicines are authorised human medicines

There are additional requirements for sheep dip.

This doesn't apply to holders of a manufacturing or marketing authorisation.

Small quantities of medicines supplied by one retailer to another may be exempt.

Application and annual fees are payable.

*[VMD]: Veterinary Medicines Directorate
